* Jon Hanna <jon@...> [2007-06-16 03:20]:
> It means that you have n resources multiplied by m sessions to
> create n*m resources with an n*m management task.
> 
> Since sessions are generally not something you can reuse safely
> m is infinite.

I don’t really get this part. If all and I mean *all* I’m using a
cookie for is to store an auth token, then how is this less
scalable than Digest? I see no reason that scalability should
differ dependening on whether you look up an auth token found in
the cookie header or a nonce to validate the hash found in the
auth header. The cost seems to have to be identical in both cases.

Regards,
-- 
Aristotle Pagaltzis // <http://plasmasturm.org/>
